column4: quick question for everyone.  from your experiences, what is a decent size for a / partition (excluding /home, including /tmp) for a more 'average' user?
would i run into issue with 8gb?
you might, , for example if you were building a dvd
I keep several 12gb partitions around for different installs. I've maxed out at 7 when I had a _lot_ installed, several desktops, etc
for most uses, yes. If mom isn't going to install a lot of stuff
she likes to 'play' in the add/remove programs area i've found, which resulted in this problem in the first place lol
so i'll be doing a bit of mucking at first.  this HAS to be GUI for her to do it herself later.  can you recommend a GTK+ dialer app?  (i use EVDO myself, but i'm using kubuntu & kppp works well)
network manager applet has a ppp dialer, but I've never used it. My favorite for gnome disappeared
when 8.04 is released, you can upgrade in place over the net, without having to reinstall
